definition: to pretend that everything is going well
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Or it can be so sugarcoated that it becomes a meaningless exercise in management.
sentences.chinese: 或者它只是粉饰太平，一种毫无意义的管理实践。

sentences.english: They don’t want it sugarcoated or whitewashed.
sentences.chinese: 他们不希望得到那些糖衣包裹的或粉饰太平的信息。

sentences.english: Advocating Petty Bourgeoisie in disguise whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 鼓吹小资情调是变相的粉饰太平。

definition: to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to sing sb's praises (mostly derogatory)
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
hypocritical
to put on an act
faked decoration
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
false/hypocritical/artificial/sham
to play deaf-mute
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
